Class BHPolygon

java.lang.Object
  BHPointGroup
      BHPolygon

public class BHPolygon
extends BHPointGroup

This is a simple container wrapper around BHPointGorup specifically for contour points, convex hulls and ellipses.

Two items of special interest are the convex hull computation which is exactly like ImageJ's and the minimum distance computation for computing the distance between two polygons.

Contact: Mike Sieracki, msieracki@bigelow.org
Author: Ben Tupper, btupper@bigelow.org
History: Developed over the course of 2009 and 2010 using ImageJ 1.43 and Mac OSX 10.5.8
at Bigelow Laboratory for Ocean Science, www.bigelow.org

Method Summary
 void add(int x, int y)
          Adds a point - assigns the point to this polygon
 double computeArea()
          Computes the area enclosed by a contour - assumes a simple polygon (non-self-intersecting) See http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/polyarea/ and ImageJ's Roi.getArea() area = 0.5*ABS(sum(x[i]*y[i+1]-x[i+1]*y[i])) for i = 0...npoints
 double computeMinimumDistanceTo(BHPolygon poly)
          Computes the minimum distance between this polygon and the provided polygon - using pythagorean quadratic sqrt(dx^2 + dy^2)
 BHPolygon duplicate()
          Duplicates the properties of this polygon and returns a new reference
 BHPolygon getConvexHull()
          Returns the convex hull of this contour
 BHPolygon getConvexHull(BHPolygon c)
          Returns the convex hull of the specified contour This is adapted (only slightly) from Wayne Rasband's gift-wrapping implementation in ij.gui.PolygonRoi class
 BHPolygon getConvexHull(int[] xCoordinates, int[] yCoordinates)
          Returns the convex hull of the specified contour This is adapted (only slightly) from Wayne Rasband's gift-wrapping implementation in ij.gui.PolygonRoi class
 double getLength()
          Returns the length of this polygon - not that a 1-pixel object has a contour length of 1 which differs from ImageJ's paradigm which would have a length of 4.
 PolygonRoi getPolygon()
          Returns a PolygonRoi see ij.gui.PolygonRoi
 double[][] getRotated(double xc, double yc, double angle)
          rotates the points about the specified centroid by the specified angle See Horn 1986.

label

public int label
This is the blob label associated with this contour

xscale

public double[] xscale
pixel scaling and offset info as [units per pixel, offset in unit]. Note that realLocation = unitsPerPixel * pixelLocation + offsetInUnits. So we might have x = xscale[0] * xPixel + xscale[1]

public double[] yscale

setScale

Sets the spatial scaling with default calibration

setScale

public void setScale(Calibration cal)

add

public void add(int x,
                int y)
Adds a point - assigns the point to this polygon

getLength

public double getLength()
Returns the length of this polygon - not that a 1-pixel object has a contour length of 1 which differs from ImageJ's paradigm which would have a length of 4.

computeArea

public double computeArea()
Computes the area enclosed by a contour - assumes a simple polygon (non-self-intersecting) See http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/polyarea/ and ImageJ's Roi.getArea() area = 0.5*ABS(sum(x[i]*y[i+1]-x[i+1]*y[i])) for i = 0...npoints

getRotated

public double[][] getRotated(double xc,
                             double yc,
                             double angle)
rotates the points about the specified centroid by the specified angle See Horn 1986. Instead of rotating this one, it simply returns the rotated coords as [nvertices][2] - this type of contour only handles integer type coords so it isn't suitable for rotation storage

getPolygon

public PolygonRoi getPolygon()
Returns a PolygonRoi see ij.gui.PolygonRoi

Returns the convex hull of this contour

getConvexHull

public BHPolygon getConvexHull(BHPolygon c)
Returns the convex hull of the specified contour This is adapted (only slightly) from Wayne Rasband's gift-wrapping implementation in ij.gui.PolygonRoi class
